meaningMnemonic: You know that 堅い is "solid" or "tough." When your <kanji>hand</kanji> is <kanji>solid</kanji> and tough, it's <vocabulary>solid</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>steady</vocabulary>. If your hand is shaky, it's the opposite, or something.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the two words 手 and 堅い combined together. Watch out for the rendaku.
